    • Constructor Detail

      • BasicCharacter

        public BasicCharacter()
        Basic Character. This character simply has animation for walking, standing and jumping. Make sure you load them before you use this class, or you will crash the program.

    • Method Detail

      • setWalk

        public void setWalk(int size,
           int refreshRate)
        Sets the walk animation frame size and frame refresh rate.
        Parameters:
        size - Number of frames for the walking animation.
        refreshRate - The refresh rate for the animation.

      • setJump

        public void setJump(int size,
           int refreshRate)
        Sets the jumping animation frame size and frame refresh rate.
        Parameters:
        size - Number of frames for the jumping animation.
        refreshRate - The refresh rate for the animation.

      • setStand

        public void setStand(int size,
            int refreshRate)
        Sets the standing animation frame size and frame refresh rate.
        Parameters:
        size - Number of frames for the standing animation.
        refreshRate - The refresh rate for the animation.

      • addWalk

        public boolean addWalk(java.awt.image.BufferedImage image)
        Adds an image to the walking animation.
        Parameters:
        image - image that you would like added to the walking animation.
        Returns:
        True if the image was added, false otherwise.

      • addJump

        public void addJump(java.awt.image.BufferedImage image)
        Adds an image to the jumping animation.
        Parameters:
        image - image that you would like added to the jumping animation.

      • addStand

        public void addStand(java.awt.image.BufferedImage image)
        Adds an image to the standing animation.
        Parameters:
        image - image that you would like added to the standing animation.

      • setLeftPressed

        public void setLeftPressed(boolean left)
        Let's you notify this character if the left button was last button pressed or not. I chose left just because.
        Parameters:
        left - true if the left key was pressed, false otherwise (right key was pressed).

      • getLeftPressed

        public boolean getLeftPressed()
        Tells you if the left button was last pressed or not. This is not always correct value, but this is what this character believes is the case.
        Returns:
        True if this character thinks left button was last button pressed, false otherwise.

      • getImage

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage getImage()
        Returns image in accordance with what the character is currently doing.
        Returns:
        Image that represents character's current state.
